alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 11 at 1:23PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Elevated river levels possible this weekend followed by a risk for ice jams late this weekend through next week... Multiple possibilities for flooding of rivers and streams exist from Friday through next week. Rainfall is likely on Friday which may be heavy enough to cause rises on rivers and streams through the weekend. Many rivers may near bankfull, with isolated minor flooding also possible. The highest risk for minor flooding is along the Illinois River and along Sugar Creek. By Saturday into Sunday, temperatures will become favorable for the development of widespread river ice. Due to the combination of elevated river levels and heavy river ice, ice jams will be possible, especially along the Fox, Des Plaines, Kankakee, and Iroquois rivers. The risk for ice jams is expected to continue through next week. Ice jams may cause rises on area rivers with little warning. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons with interests along area rivers should closely monitor the latest forecasts. This product will be updated by tomorrow afternoon.
